hero-description: Wolfblood is the ultimate Turkish Werewolf experience on Telegram. Dive into a thrilling game of strategy and survival with hundreds of unique roles and diverse game modes.
feature-1-desc: Discover unique roles, from the humble Villager to the powerful Alpha Wolf.
feature-2-desc: Experience different modes like Treasure, Ranked, and more.
feature-3-desc: Join thousands of players in active groups and compete on the leaderboards.
start-step-2: Add the bot to a group chat or use /grouplist to see active groups
start-step-3: Type /startgame and let the hunt begin!
footer-text: Â© 2025 Wolfblood Team - All Rights Reserved.
play-obj-p1: Wolfblood is a digital version of the classic "Werewolf" game, played via a Telegram bot. This game combines elements of strategy, cooperation, and hidden identities, and can be played with a minimum of 5 people. Players take on different roles, and each person's goal is to ensure their group survives and to eliminate their opponents.
play-obj-p2: The primary objective of the villagers is to uncover the elements of evil in the village and neutralize them through lynching. During this process, careful observation, logical discussion, and analyzing the behavior of other players are crucial. Villagers can only eliminate wolves or other evil roles with accurate guesses.
play-obj-p3: The goal of the wolves is to equal or exceed the number of villagers. They move secretly during the night, attempting to neutralize villagers. Strategy and cooperation are very important for the wolves, as one wrong move can lead to a decrease in their pack size and a loss of the game.
play-obj-p4: Some roles are called "solo evils," and their objective is to survive on their own. These players do not side with either the villagers or the wolves; their strategies are entirely self-serving. Solo evils aim to survive until the end of the game by manipulating other players and acting with caution.
play-phase-p1: During the night phase, roles with special abilities become active. As the wolves secretly choose their victims, some special roles can also use their abilities. This phase takes place in complete silence, and the players' actions are hidden from others.
play-phase-p2: When day arrives, villagers and other roles discuss what happened during the night, evaluate clues, and debate who is suspicious. This phase highlights strategic and persuasive skills; the right analysis can determine the fate of the game.
play-phase-p3: Following the discussions, the villagers and some other roles decide to eliminate a player from the game by lynching them. Lynching is a critical step to reduce the evil in the village, but wrong decisions can make the job easier for the wolves and evil roles.
play-strat-li1: Players should carefully watch the behavior of others and adjust their strategies accordingly.
play-strat-li2: While wolves maintain secrecy, villagers should gain an advantage through cooperation and logical deduction.
play-strat-li3: Solo evil roles must be careful and patient to manipulate everyone.
play-strat-p1: The game offers a dynamic experience that combines logic, communication, and strategy at every stage. Wolfblood is full of different strategies and surprises in every round. Players hiding their identities, forming alliances, and trying to outsmart the opposing side make the game both exciting and challenging.
play-rules-p1: To ensure a fair and enjoyable game for everyone, all players must adhere to the following rules:
play-rules-li1: No Cheating: Using multiple accounts (multi-accounting) in a single game is strictly forbidden.
play-rules-li2: No Gamethrowing / Betrayal: You must play to achieve your role's win condition. Intentionally helping another team win is not allowed (see "Betrayal & Cases" tab for details).
play-rules-li3: Respect All Players: Harassment, flooding, spamming, personal insults, or any form of toxic behavior will not be tolerated.
play-rules-li4: No External Communication: Do not share game-related information (like your role, who you targeted, or screenshots) with other players outside of the main game chat (e.t., in private messages), unless your role (like Mason or Werewolf) allows it.
play-rules-li5: Follow Admin/Mod Instructions: Bot Staff and Moderators are here to help. Please respect their decisions.
play-rules-link-p1: Global rules for all Wolfblood groups.
play-rules-link-p2: Click to view the channel â”
play-betrayal-p1: Definition: "Betrayal" (also known as gamethrowing) is the act of intentionally and knowingly acting against your own team's victory conditions to help an opposing team win.
play-betrayal-li1: A Villager refusing to vote for a confirmed Werewolf.
play-betrayal-li2: A Seer publicly revealing the identity of a crucial village role (like the Guardian Angel or Gunner) to the wolves.
play-betrayal-li3: A Werewolf intentionally refusing to attack a villager to help the village team win.
play-betrayal-li4: A Solo Role (like Serial Killer) who stops killing to help the village lynch the last wolf.
play-betrayal-li5: Any player sharing screenshots or private role information to prove their identity to an opposing team.
play-betrayal-p2: Betrayal ruins the game for all players. Reported and confirmed cases of betrayal will result in disciplinary action, which may include a warning, removal from the group, a temporary ban, or a permanent ban from all Wolfblood groups.
play-betrayal-link-p1: Report or review betrayal cases here.
play-betrayal-link-p2: Click to view the channel â”
roles-main-desc: Wolf Blood is basically based on 3 teams. The Villagers, the Werewolves and the Solo Roles who go it alone. Each team wins as a team by cooperating. The Village team must lynch and eliminate the Werewolves with unity and the right strategic moves. The Wolf Pack can win by disguising their identities and convincing the villagers to believe them, eliminating each player. Solo roles are on their own and have their own goals. Solo Killers, on the other hand, must eliminate all players in the game, regardless of team or role. Click on the buttons to see the roles and detailed descriptions of each team.
roles-v-villager-desc: You are a humble villager destined to spend your days plowing and eating. The Villager role can appear more than once in a single game. As stated, this role has no function other than voting in the lynch.
roles-v-mason-desc: If there are other masons, you'll know who they are. Otherwise, you're no different from a simple villager. You must pay close attention to mason meetings. If someone doesn't show up, it could cause big problems!
roles-v-clumsy-desc: You will try to vote, but with a 50% chance, you will vote for someone else instead of the person you intended. Still, you are part of the village team.
roles-v-wolfman-desc: Because you spend most of your time in the woods where the real wolves are, the Seer will be confused and think you are a werewolf! You are an innocent villager, but your living standards are quite confusing for the other villagersâ€¦
roles-v-gunner-desc: You have two bullets. During the day, you can choose to shoot another player. Everyone will hear the gunshot and know that you are the Gunslinger. You will have extra bullets depending on the number of players. You'll have more shots in larger games.
roles-v-blacksmith-desc: You are the village's metalworker. You have a small amount of silver dust, enough to prevent wolves from attacking for one night. During the day, you can choose to grind it into dust and spread it around the village. Other than that, you are just a villager.
roles-v-mayor-desc: Your vote during the lynch will count as two votes after you reveal yourself.
roles-v-prince-desc: You've escaped your boring and pampered life and spend most of your days with the villagers. If they try to lynch you, you will reveal your royal lineage, and the public will realize their mistake, so no one will be lynched.
roles-v-sandman-desc: Once per game, you can use your magical sand to put everyone into such a deep sleep that no one can perform their night action.
roles-v-troublemaker-desc: The village's angry teenager. One day you will get so mad that the village will lynch two people instead of one!
roles-v-doctor-desc: You can bring a player back to life with a single touch, and remember, in games with more players, you may get a chance to resurrect more than one.
roles-v-ch-desc: You are the leader of the village. While this village is struggling against the dark creatures of the night, you will not allow corruption and will protect the unity of this village! Your goal is to visit players every night to find out if they are a cult member. The moment you detect cultists, you will take their lives. You cannot detect wolves, but if you visit the Serial Killer, you will die!
roles-v-harlot-desc: You will choose a player to visit during the night and spend the night at someone else's house. If the player you visit is not a Wolf/Serial Killer, you will survive and be convinced that the people you visit are partially harmless. If you visit a Wolf or Serial Killer, or their targets, you will die. During visits, werewolves won't find you at home, but the same doesn't apply to the Serial Killer.
roles-v-harlot-note: *Can survive even if visiting the Arsonist or Seer roles. They will see the Arsonist role as not at home but will think roles like Seer, Traitor, and Demon are harmless.
roles-v-seer-desc: Every night you will choose a player and see their role. Some roles might confuse you, so you will need to be very careful with this role.
roles-v-ga-desc: Every night, you will choose a player and protect them from possible attacks. If your target is attacked, you will save their life. If you try to protect a Werewolf, your chance of survival is 50%.
roles-v-detective-desc: During the day, you will choose a player to determine their identity. When the time for lynching comes, the information of the player you chose will come to you. The werewolves have a 40% chance of detecting you.
roles-v-traitor-desc: You are no different from an ordinary villager until all living werewolves die. After all werewolves are dead, you will turn into a werewolf and continue to terrorize the village. The Seer can see you as a Villager or a Werewolfâ€¦ It's completely up to chance.
roles-v-cursed-desc: You are no different from an ordinary villager until you are attacked by werewolves. When werewolves attack you, your curse will be triggered and you will immediately turn into a werewolf.
roles-v-wildchild-desc: On the first night, you will choose a role model for yourself. If your role model dies/is killed by any means, you will immediately turn into a werewolf.
roles-v-wildchild-note: *The Wild Child role has a chance to appear in a game if the first night starts with 120 seconds. If the first night is 90 seconds, there is no chance for the Wild Child role to appear!
roles-v-cupid-desc: A Goddess sent to Earth with a bow and two arrows. You can choose two players (including yourself) to make them fall in love forever. If one dies, the other also dies of grief. AFK deaths are an exception.
roles-v-cupid-note: *The Eros role has a chance to appear in a game if the first night starts with 120 seconds. If the first night is 90 seconds, there is no chance for the Eros role to appear!
roles-v-drunk-desc: You are no different from an ordinary villager. You just drink a lot, which causes the alcohol level in your blood to increase. If the wolves choose to eat you, they will not be able to attack the next night.
roles-v-beholder-desc: You will be told who the Seer is. You will be the one who knows if the Seer is in the game or not. You will also know when a new Seer comes.
roles-v-appseer-desc: For now, you are a simple villager. However, when the Seer dies, you will become the new Seer as their successor.
roles-v-wiseelder-desc: You can survive one werewolf attack - the same can't be said for a second time. If the Gunslinger, Alchemist, or Hunter targets you, they will lose their powers out of grief and turn into a normal villager.
roles-v-gravedigger-desc1: The dead stay dead, the living are with us. From the 2nd night onwards, you will dig graves for the dead players. Yes, even the worst ones deserve to be buried with honor! During the time you are burying the dead players, you will not be at home. Therefore, your visitors will either not find you at home or they will fall into one of the graves and die while trying to get to your house. Being outside has its benefits, as well as its drawbacks. By chance, you can be noticed and killed by werewolves or the Serial Killer.
roles-v-gravedigger-desc2: You can use the ability of one of the dead players once.
roles-v-boss-desc: You have a strong hatred for cultists. Whenever you encounter a cult, you join their ranks by pretending to be one of them. However, the cultists are aware of your true identity and you secretly inform the village team of the number of cultists every night.
roles-v-skeleton-desc: Even beyond the grave, your spirit will haunt the village! After you die, you will have a chance to block a player's abilities. You can make this choice at any time and it will block all of the player's actions for 1 day.
roles-v-miner-desc: Every night, you dig tunnels to the villagers' homes. Thanks to the tunnels you dig, players with night actions will get confused and unknowingly go to a random house. You cannot dig the same player's house two nights in a row.
roles-v-executioner-desc: The Executioner takes responsibility for the lynching process by showcasing extraordinary skills and challenging other villagers. When the Executioner's true identity is revealed, they take control by choosing two people from the village. The villagers must then use their votes to decide which of these two people will be executed. The person chosen by the majority will be executed.
roles-v-hunter-desc: You can't sleep well and never go to bed without your rifle. If you die, you can choose someone else to kill. If you are attacked by a werewolf, you have a chance to defeat a werewolf, but you cannot choose to kill.
roles-v-hunter-note: If you are attacked by a werewolf, your chance of winning is 30%. Your chance will increase by 20% for each additional werewolf. Also, if you are killed by the Serial Killer, you will have a chance to shoot someone, just like in a lynch.
roles-v-chemist-desc1: You are a mad scientist who experiments on living things. On the first night, you prepare 4 potions, 2 of which are deadly poisons and 2 are harmless painkillers. You can choose a target to give them one of each and leave them to decide their own fate!
roles-v-chemist-desc2: If an evil role dies from the poison, you get 2 extra potions. After visiting someone, you must wait 1 day before visiting another player.
roles-v-snitch-desc: The most curious resident of the entire village. Your passion for gossip has led you to learn everyone's hidden truths. In your last breath, you can expose any player's deepest, darkest secret, causing them to reveal their identity.
roles-v-pawn-desc: Every night, you will choose someone to protect. If your target is attacked, you will sacrifice yourself. If you try to protect a Wolf or Serial Killer, you will die.
roles-v-pawn-note: You have no chance against the Serial Killer's target. They can kill both you and your target at the same time.
roles-v-soldier-desc: When the sun rises, you can choose to save someone from the lynch votes. If the selected player is targeted for lynching and dies, you will have a one-time ability to redirect the lynch votes to another player of your choice.
roles-v-fool-desc: The Fool is said to be a Seerâ€¦ When they choose to see someone's role at night, they are told a random role.
roles-v-augur-desc: You have the power to see things, but you are quite different from a seer or oracle. You are someone who can see roles that are not in the village. You also won't see the same role twice!
roles-v-oracle-desc: Every night you can choose to look at someone, but you will only see what they are NOT. You will be given the role of someone else who is still alive in the game. So pay attention to which role is mentioned, as it means someone is still alive.
roles-v-preacher-desc: You can pray for a player during the night. If the player you prayed for is killed, you will learn the identity and role of their killer. However, they will also learn your identity. This ability can be used from the second night onwards.
roles-w-werewolf-desc: Every night you will choose someone to eat. Your goal is to manipulate the village folk, make them believe you, and to equalize the number of living players with the number of your wolf pack. Your goal is to create chaos in the village, eliminate all your enemies, and win!
roles-w-alpha-desc: You are the source of the trouble. Your bite is the cause of the curse that turns people into werewolves. Every night, you will choose a human to attack and kill, but as long as you are alive, there will be a 20% chance that your victim will turn into a werewolf.
roles-w-cub-desc: You are very loved by the wolf pack. Like other wolves, you will choose a villager to attack and kill every night. If you are killed, your wolf pack will go crazy with rage and attack two people the next night. You'll still be dead, though.
roles-w-lycan-desc: You are a wolf, but the Seer will be confused and see you as a villager.
roles-w-snow-desc: Every night, instead of following your pack to hunt someone, you wander alone to freeze someone, independent of the pack. The frozen person (if any) cannot use any night action. However, their victim will have some residual power the next night, so they cannot be frozen a second time in a row.
roles-w-shadow-desc: Just like ordinary werewolves, you can kill someone every night. But you have a shadow ability that is different from all other wolves. When you use your abilities, shadows hide the villagers' votes as '?' on the bot, but they remain visible to the group. However, the ability does not affect the wolf group and allows them to see who they are lynching.
roles-w-conjurer-desc: You have a secret ability. When you use it, the person with the fewest votes, not the most, will die in the lynch vote.
roles-w-rogue-desc: You are known for your cunning and ability to impersonate another player. During the first night, you have the opportunity to choose a player to mimic. If you are checked by insightful roles or die, you will be known as the role you are mimicking. If the player you impersonated has any revealing ability, you can also mimic it. But remember that this will have no real effect.
roles-w-illusionist-desc1: You wear a mask made of liesâ€¦ and it works.
roles-w-illusionist-desc2: When insightful roles check you, they see a random villager role, and yes, this role actually exists in the game. You know which one it is from the very beginning. If you are lynched, that poor soul is dragged to the grave with you. If they are already dead, you will choose a new target. Bend reality. Deceive the village. Take someone with you. You're not just a wolf, you are the show itself.
roles-w-sorcerer-desc: You will ally with the creatures of the night instead of the villagers. At night, you will use your power to find wolves or insightful/dangerous roles like the Seer. You only win if the wolves win. Enjoy helping to destroy those miserable villagers.
roles-w-poseidon-desc: Once per game, you can kill a random player on the village team by unleashing a tsunami. When you decide to unleash a tsunami, the village will be notified that a tsunami is approaching but your identity will not be revealed.
roles-s-tanner-desc: Your goal is quite simple: to be lynched! Your masochistic feelings are at their peak and a specific source of pain drives you crazy! You only win the game if you are lynched, and everyone else loses. Any other way of dying is torture for you.
roles-s-doppel-desc1: Legend says your ancestors were shapeshifters and could choose any form they wanted. You inherited some of their abilities. Choose a player, and when that player dies, you will take over their role. You can never win in your pure form! After you obtain the role of the player you chose, you will then serve the team to which that role belongs.
roles-s-doppel-desc2: You have no Cult Conversion rate. It will be determined by the conversion percentage of the role you choose.
roles-s-doppel-note: *The Doppelganger role has a chance to appear in a game if the first night starts with 120 seconds. If the first night is 90 seconds, there is no chance for the Doppelganger role to appear!
roles-s-thief-desc1: The Thief is a role played in two modes.
roles-s-thief-desc2: The normal Thief chooses a target every night and steals their role. If they succeed in stealing the role, the target will lose their role and turn into a Villager.
roles-s-thief-desc3: In Endless Thief mode, this cycle continues. The Thief steals the role from their target, and the person who had their role stolen becomes the new Thief.
roles-s-sk-desc: You're a psycho who just escaped from the local asylum. Your goal is for everyone else to die. Every night you can add a player's body to your collection. There is very little power that can stop you, you can prevail against everyone! To win, you must be the only one left alive.
roles-s-arso-desc: Every night, you will visit houses to douse them with gasoline. You can either set your single target on fire the next night to kill them, or you can accumulate multiple victims for a mass slaughter and set them on fire. You only win the game if you are the last one left alive.
roles-s-arso-note: *You will have extra gasoline during the day as long as there are no werewolves/Serial Killers left alive in the game.
roles-s-slave-desc: You are not on the side of any team in the village. Your only goal is to deliver the target given to you into the cruel hands of justice (to lynch them). You must get your target lynched, believing that they disrupt the peace of the village. If your target dies for any reason other than lynching, you must fall into despair and try to get yourself lynched. If your target is lynched, you win the game.
roles-c-cultist-desc: Each night, you can choose one player to try and convert to your cult. If all players still alive at the end of the game are Cultists, they will win.
roles-c-100-desc1: The roles listed below are directly inclined to convert to the Cult. Any attempt to convert them will result in them directly joining the Cult.

roles-c-80-desc1: The roles listed below have a high tendency to convert to the Cult. They show little 'faith'.
roles-c-70harlot-note: Note: The Harlot is not at home during their nightly visits. They are immune to Cult conversions while visiting. When they stay home, they have a 70% chance of being converted.
roles-c-60ga-note: Note: The Guardian Angel is not at home during their nightly visits. They are immune to Cult conversions while visiting. When they stay home, they have a 60% chance of being converted.
roles-c-60-desc1: The roles listed here are closer to the "High-Faith" class. They have a higher chance of resisting the Cult.
roles-c-50hunter-note: Note: The Town Hunter is clearly not fond of visitors. In the event of a Cultist visit, there is a 30% chance they will kill the visitor. If this is successful, the remaining 70% is split 50/50: either the Cultists succeed in converting them, or the Hunter resists and does not join the Cult.
roles-c-50-desc1: As you might guess, the roles on this list have a 50/50 chance of being converted. It's pure luck!
roles-c-40-desc1: The roles on this list can be considered "Resistant". They will put up a strong fight against the Cult.

roles-c-30digger-note: Note: The Grave Digger is not at home after the 2nd night as they're busy with the dead. The Cultists will either not find them at home or will die by falling into an open grave on their way.
roles-c-30-desc1: The players on this list are "High-Faith" roles. While their presence is a threat to the Cultists, they are the last ones to be targeted for conversion.

roles-c-0doppel-note: Note: The Doppelganger is immune to Cultists until their role model dies and they take on a new role. After taking on a new role, their conversion rate changes based on that role.
roles-c-0ch-note: Note: Immune to Cultists. Any attempt to convert them is fatal. If Cultists attempt to convert them, they will lose their newest member, and the Cultist Hunter will be made aware of the remaining number of cult members.
roles-c-0sk-note: Note: Immune to Cultists. Any attempt to convert results in a absolute Cultist death.
roles-c-0arso-note: Note: Immune to Cultists. Cult members cannot find their target at home.
roles-c-0wolf-note: Note: All types of Wolves are immune to Cultists. Cult members cannot find their target at home. If the Wolves do not attack (stay home), any attempted conversion will result in a absolute Cultist death.

mech-main-desc: Welcome to the core of Wolfblood. This page details the game's internal logic, from role balancing to the complex scoring functions that determine group rankings. Explore the tabs below to understand how the algorithm works.

mech-note-cub: If any Ally (ğŸ§œ/ğŸ”®) or additional Wolf ğŸº exist: 12

mech-note-ga: If Arsonist ğŸ”¥ exist in the game: 8
mech-note-seer: If Lycan ğŸºğŸŒ or Wolfman ğŸ‘±ğŸŒš exist in the game: 5

updates-26-p2: â€¢ Jinx is the villageâ€™s walking calamity. Even the gentlest choice he make seems cursed to go awry. His persistent bad luck causes his action choices to show up as "?" in the bot. Anyone who visits him at night will suffer from the misfortune for 1 day. If Jinx is lynched, the bad luck will reach its peak and take the life of another player who voted for him.
updates-26-p4: â€¢ Illusionist wolf has been edited and re-activated. At the beginning of the game, you will be told a random villager role. If seer checks you, theyâ€™ll see that fake role instead of your true self. And hereâ€™s the twist: if you get lynched, the unlucky villager tied to your illusion goes down with you! If that villagerâ€™s already out of the game, you get to pick a new target to share your fate.
updates-26-p6: â€¢ Snitch has been updated and re-activated. Snitch is the nosiest resident in the entire village. His passion for gossip has led him to learn everyoneâ€™s hidden truths. On his final breath, snitch can make any player reveal their identity by snitching on their deepest darkest secret. Additionally, if the wolves dare to attack Snitch, thereâ€™s a 25% chance that one wolfâ€™s identity gets revealed.
updates-26-p8: FakeRole tickets can be used to set a Fake Role for you using /fakerole command. Once you activate the ticket, your role will show up as the fake role you set, hiding your real role for one game. Get ready to have some fun and confuse everyone ğŸ˜

He can choose a target to give one of each, leaving them to decide their own fate! If a bad role die from the poison, chemist receive 2 extra potions. After visiting someone, he will have to wait 1 day before visiting another player.
updates-25-p4: â€¢ Pawn has been revised. Pawn now can protect their target from Serial Killer too. Additionally, if pawn choose to protect wolf, there is a 50% chance pawn dies. However if pawn visit Serial Killer, he will die instantly.
updates-25-p6: â€¢ Grave Digger has been modified. Grave digger now possess a one-time ability to use any talent from newly dead villagers for 1 day.
updates-25-p8: â€¢ Rogue Wolf has been revised. Rogue wolf can't swap identities anymore. But instead, he now has the chance to impersonate another player. When rogue wolf is dead or checked, his role will be seen as his target's. If the target has a revealing ability, rogue wolf can imitate the action, but it will be ineffective. More details...

updates-24-p2: You don't side with any team in the village. Your sole purpose is to deliver the target given to you into the merciless hands of justice. You will be randomly given a target by the bot who has disturbed the peace of the village and your goal is to have them lynched. If your target dies for any reason other than lynching, you must despair and get yourself lynched. You win the game when your target is lynched but the game continues.
updates-24-p4: You will not be seen as lowly villager anymore. The pain you have experienced in the past have turned you into a gloomy and hopeless person. However, this hopelessness holds a dark power that can affect others in the village. If you are killed by lynching, one of the players who voted against you will fall under the curse of your despair and lose their abilities.

updates-19-p1: ğŸ†• /rep command: Report bugs directly to the developers by typing "/rep" followed by the reason when you see any error in the game. Example usage: '/rep lynch error'.
updates-19-p2: ğŸ†• /gameban command: Ban a person from participating in group games using this command. Banned players will be unable to join any games in your group for a specified period of time or until the ban is lifted. Specify the ban duration with time units like hours (h), minutes (m), or days (d). If no duration is specified, the ban is indefinite. Example usage: '/gameban @kediben 5h' to ban the player for 5 hours.
updates-19-p3: ğŸ†• /remgameban command: Unban a previously banned person from playing in your group using this command.
updates-19-p4: ğŸ†• /myemojis command: Enable or disable emojis, including rank emojis. Customize which emojis will appear using this command.
updates-19-p5: ğŸ†• /showgametag: With this command, you can easily join or leave the tag list for a group. Once you join, the bot will continuously tag you, even if you haven't played any games. updates-17-p4: You are a wolf with magical abilities. When you are about to die by lynching, you can use your dark magic to redirect the lynch vote to another player. However, you only have 20 seconds to cast your spells before your death so you must hurry, and when you do, your true identity will be revealed to everyone. 6 > Players
updates-17-p6: During the night, you can pray for a player. If the player you prayed for is killed, you will learn the identity of their killer and their role. However, they will also discover your identity. This ability can be used starting from the second night. 6 > Players
updates-17-p8: You have the authority to judge the villagers. During the night, you can select a player to judge. The trial will last for one day. When the next day begins, you can choose to either execute and kill the suspect or reveal their role to the village. 6 > Players
updates-16p-p2:
When you vote for a player, you can secretly choose to vote for another player. No one will be able to see whom you are lynching because you are surrounded by smoke. You can trick the villagers with fake lynch votes. You will have 2 lynch options. The first time you vote, the village will see it, but it will not be counted. Your second vote will be counted.
7 > Players
updates-16p-p4:
Once per game, you can kill a random player on the village team by unleashing a tsunami. When you decide to release a tsunami, the village will be notified that a tsunami is approaching, but your identity will not be revealed.
7 > Players
updates-16p-p6:
Every day, you can pass judgment on the people of the village to determine if they have killed someone during the night. If the player has committed a murder, the entire village will be informed and the player will be exposed. If the player did not kill anyone, you will leave the village. You cannot pass judgment again for 1 day. Only 2 trials are allowed.
6 > Players

updates-14-h2: ğŸ¾ BOT NOW AVAILABLE TO EVERYONE :
updates-14-p3:
Now, anyone can add the bot to their group. The bot has been activated for group addition.
Groups that want to try out the bot's new features and have a great gaming experience can now add the bot directly to their group and start playing games.
However, they need to meet certain requirements. The groups must have more than 70 members, and the bot must have permissions to delete messages, ban users, pin messages, and add users.
Once you have these permissions, you can start playing games immediately.
Have fun!

updates-14-p4:

For example, to add 10 roles, you had to write 10 emojis side by side. But now, there is a much easier method.
Before writing the role, you can write how many you want next to it.
This way, the specified number of roles will be added automatically.
For example: '/startcustom 9ğŸ”ª,9ğŸ¯' Starting the game is now much easier. It is currently operating in the 0-9 range.

updates-13-p1:
Are you ready for a brand new adventure?
Throughout the year, one player will win an emoji every month during the tournaments!
The tournament will continue from the 1st to the 30th of each month.
The total points earned at the end of each game will be added up as the monthly score, and the player with the highest score at the end of the month will win the emoji.
Monthly tournament scores start at 0, and points earned at the end of each game are added.
In addition, there is also a monthly group list.
At the end of each month, the top group in the monthly tournament can choose one player from their own group to win an emoji.
updates-13-p2:
This month's tournament begins today.
However, in the other months, all points will be reset on March 1st, and a new tournament will begin.

{ğŸª„}

updates-11-p2:
With this update, the "top groups" feature has been added to the game to increase competition between groups.
Also, you no longer need to use any commands to be included in the leaderboard. Everything is automatically created by the bot when a new member joins your group, and it is also automatically removed from the leaderboard when a player leaves your group.
Also, a player can join more than one group and will be included in the stats of that group.
Note: To ensure fair competition between groups, the calculation of group points is based on the sum of the points of players with 1200 points and more.
updates-11-p3: /topgroup : With this command you can see the top 10 groups in the score list.
updates-11-p4: /groupstats : With this command you can see the top 10 players in your group.

staff-kadir-desc: The founder and lead developer of the bot. The person who initiated the Wolfblood project and defined its core vision. Makes all strategic decisions regarding the bot's future and growth.
staff-ismet-desc1: Responsible for the visual design of the website and frontend development processes. Codes all necessary page layouts and user interfaces. Generate necessary roles and modes according to the demand.
about-intro-p1: Wolfblood bot was developed in May 2022 and was mainly inspired by @werewolfbot, a fantastic creation by Para, the Father of the Telegram Werewolf Game and the original developer of the bot. We will be forever grateful to Para for inventing and coding this game.
about-intro-p2: ğŸ¤ We would also like to thank Para and the entire GreyWolf Development Team for keeping the original bot running since 2016.
about-intro-p3: ğŸ™ We would also like to take this opportunity to thank everyone who has helped us in the Wolf Blood Community, not just limited to our developer Kadir {ğŸ“Ÿ}, Core Team {ğŸª½}, Translators {âœï¸}, Moderators {ğŸ’ }, Donors {ğŸ’µ}, Sponsors {ğŸ’}, and to our beloved Players {ğŸ¾} who have shown unending love and support for the bot.
about-ideas-li1: Most of our ideas for new roles are originally our own, while some are adapted from Wolvesville and GreyWolf role suggestions.
about-ideas-li2: The rest of the roles are from the original Werewolf Bot.
about-ideas-li3: Meanwhile, all feature ideas came from the Core Team and Wolf Blood players who have reached out to us through @Wolfbloodsupport and @Wolfbloodadminbot.
about-ideas-p1: Please see the following links for reference:
about-roles-p1: Wolfblood is constantly evolving, and we're excited to introduce a fresh batch of roles and innovative game modes to keep the gameplay thrilling and unpredictable.
about-roles-p-love: Love Mode: Are you ready for some romance? In this mode, every player is in love. On the first night, your lover will be chosen, and you'll find out who they are the next day. This mode is exclusive to games with an even number of players (e.g., 6, 8, 10).
about-roles-p-custom: Simplified Custom Mode: Starting a custom game is now easier than ever. You can simply specify the number of roles you want to add, and the bot will do the rest. For example, instead of typing /startcustom ğŸ”ªğŸ”ªğŸ”ªğŸ”ªğŸ”ªğŸ”ªğŸ”ªğŸ”ªğŸ”ªğŸ”ª, you can now just use /startcustom 9ğŸ”ª. This feature currently works for adding up to 9 of each role at a time.
about-roles-p-treasure: Treasure Mode: This mode is a spin on the standard ranked game with an enhanced point system that scales with the number of players. You'll earn more points for your victories and get a chance to win mystery boxes. These boxes contain temporary rewards like Player Tags, Temporary Emojis, ForceStart Tokens, and Jersey Numbers. At the end of the game, a few players are randomly selected to receive one of these prizes for 3 to 7 days.
about-store-p1: The Wolfblood Store is where players can enhance their gaming experience with various in-game items. The primary currency is WB Mint (ğŸª™), earned simply by playing.
about-store-p2:
â—½ï¸ Wolf Blood Currency (WB Mint):
How to earn Mint? Simply by playing a game. It will be given to players randomly by the bot based on the number of players in the game.
about-store-li3: ... and so on up to 10 ğŸª™ at 100 players.
about-store-p3:
â—½ï¸ Emoji Fragments (ğŸ§©):
Fragments enable players to create custom emojis. The emoji store has been updated to offer both temporary (1 week, 1 month, 1 year) and permanent emojis.
about-store-p4:
â—½ï¸ Role Vouchers (ğŸªª):
These encourage players to try out different roles and diversify their gameplay. Prices vary per role (Basic, Advance, Expert, and Pro).
about-store-p5:
â—½ï¸ FS (ForceStart) Tokens (â­ï¸):
Allow players to /forcestart a game without being an admin. You can purchase 1 FS Token for 5 Mints.
about-store-p6:
â—½ï¸ Gifting & Transfer Fees (ğŸ”‚):
The fee for the /transfer command has been set to 5 Mints. This command can be used only once a day, while /gift has unlimited usage.
about-store-p7: âœ… Telegram Stars (â­ï¸): You can now use Telegram Stars to purchase a wide range of items, including temporary emojis, custom GIFs, Mints, custom messages, and role vouchers.

about-items-p1: Discover unique items that give you a strategic advantage in the game.
about-items-p2: ğŸŒ± Fake Name Ticket [ğŸ­]: Use the /fakename command to set a fake name that the bot will use throughout the game. Confuse your opponents and gain an edge!
about-items-p3: ğŸŒ± ForceJoin Token [ğŸ’ª]: With this token, you can force another player to join the game.
about-items-p4: ğŸŒ± Bonus Points Ticket [ğŸ°]: Activate this ticket to multiply your points by x2, helping you level up your gameplay.
about-items-p5: ğŸŒ± Fake Role Ticket [ğŸ”–]: Use the /fakerole command to set a fake role. Once activated, your role will appear as the fake role, hiding your real one for a single game. Get ready to have some fun and confuse everyone!
about-donations-p1: We are grateful for all donations that help support the bot's development. Donors receive special features to show our appreciation.
about-donations-p2: âœ”ï¸ Player Tags: Donors can now set a custom 3-letter tag to display their VIP status in the community. For example: [PRO] Wolf Blood.
about-donations-p3: âœ”ï¸ Emoji Identifiers: Donors receive an updated emoji based on their donation amount:
about-donations-p4: âœ”ï¸ Special Message [ğŸ“]: With a donation level above $50, you can use the /specialmessage command to set a custom message that appears randomly at the end of the game if you win.
about-Tdonations-p5: âœ”ï¸ Custom GIFs: Donors who contribute $10 or more can set custom GIFs to be displayed in-game.
